pageTitle: FERTRELL - Fruit Tree and Grape Recommendations
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {8752=- 50:1 Pre-leaf or bud cover all exposed growth. - For insect control use 100:1 as needed. Add Pyganic to mix per directions if desired !! Do Not Apply During Blossom! Needs To Be Allowed To Pollinate!!}
textBeforeTable: The Fertrell Fruit Tree and Grape Recommendations Apply fertilizer around base of fruit trees in a circle equal to the length of the branches. This will cover the root system which, is equal to the expanse of the braches in size. All recommendations are in pounds per inch diameter of the base of the tree. A tree that measures four inches across the base and is recommended 2lbs per inch diameter should have 8 pounds of fertilizer spread on the ground covering out to the edge of the branch length. Soil Mineralizer and gypsum or Aragonite are added for mineralization and root growth in the fall. Super N and Foliar fertilizer are added in the spring for leaf, blossom, and fruit growth. textAfterTable: * Dormant oil - Pure Spray Green or Insect Spray - 50:1 Pre-leaf or bud cover all exposed growth. - For insect control use 100:1 as needed. Add Pyganic to mix per directions if desired !! Do Not Apply During Blossom! Needs To Be Allowed To Pollinate!! ** Foliar Feeding - Combine the following  Liquid #3, Three quarts Humic Acid, One Pint  Water, 10 gallons or as needed to cover all trees Apply the mixture twice as follows Full foliage ½ fruit set !! Do Not Apply During Blossom! Needs To Be Allowed To Pollinate!! Back to top   Contact us |Programs| Video Gallery | Specials| Sitemap | Privacy policy
